dimensions: Warp: 261 cm (103 in.). Weft: 100 cm (39 1/4 in.). Both selvedges present. Pattern: height of repeat: 101 cm (39 3/4 in.). Width of printing plate: 96.5 cm (38 in.) Designed so that when lengths were sewn together they would form a half-drop repeat.
title: La Maison qui brule
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved plate on plain weave foundation
description: Two prominent images, a wine press at the left and a burning house at the right with other spaces filled with people, buildings, and other rural scenes. In red on white.
name: Textile
